tweet: Great news! https://twitter.com/huntsvillealcoc/status/1144702787932106752 …

Pleased that the House chose to take up and pass the Senate’s bipartisan border supplemental package by a vote of 305-102. Great news – thank you to my colleagues for coming together to address the humanitarian and security crisis at our southern border.  https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/news/house-passes-senate-bipartisan-border-supplemental-appropriations-package …

The Senate has passed the #FY20NDAA – an essential step in providing our military with the means & resources to best protect our nation. I support this bill & will continue my work on the Appropriations Cmte to ensure that our defense priorities are funded. https://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/newsreleases?ID=E2FC49EE-0656-4DA1-BCDE-96A3E044A854 … pic.twitter.com/uYyKxvQ1th

There is no excuse for Congress leaving town at the end of the week without getting this done. Let’s come together and do our job.  https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/news/senate-passes-its-bipartisan-border-supplemental-appropriations-package …

Those who want to alleviate the suffering on our southern border now have a bipartisan path forward in the Senate bill. Those who choose to obstruct over partisan demands will soon have a lot of questions to answer when this crisis escalates further.

So I say to our colleagues in the House, now that there is bipartisan acknowledgment that the crisis on our southern border is real, do not derail the one bipartisan vehicle with a real chance of becoming law.

The Senate passed the $4.59B bipartisan border supplemental appropriations package with an overwhelming vote of 84-8. This is a solid bill. It provides the resources needed to address the crisis we face. It contains no poison pills, unlike the version that came out of the House.

Pleased that POTUS has announced his intent to nominate Mark Esper to be the next @DeptofDefense Secretary. Esper, a West Point graduate & former @USArmy Secretary, is a highly-qualified choice with distinguished military service & proven leadership abilities. This is good news.

Today I had the honor of presenting UAH student Warren Griggs of #Vestavia with the Congressional Award Gold Medal for his outstanding service, leadership, & achievements. Proud of him for all his hard work & look forward to hearing of his future success. @TheAward #Gold19 pic.twitter.com/0JnqXtI0s5

Thank you to @SenatorLeahy and our colleagues on the appropriations committee for working together in a bipartisan manner to advance the border security supplemental appropriations package today. The Senate is moving forward on the border crisis. pic.twitter.com/rbiG3DikDo

The Senate Appropriations Cmte advanced a $4.59B border security supplemental by a vote of 30-1. Proud of the bipartisan effort that took place as we work to address the crisis at our southern border. Looking forward to its consideration by the full Senate. https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/news/senate-appropriations-advances-bipartisan-border-supplemental-package …
Happy National #FlagDay! The American flag is a representation of liberty, equality, & justice in the US. Today we celebrate & honor this symbol that represents our nation’s freedom.

#OnThisDay in 1775, the Second Continental Congress established the @USArmy during the American Revolution - 244 years ago. Thank you to the men and women in the Army who have fought and continue to fight to protect our great nation. #ArmyBday

Great news – @realDonaldTrump has signed the disaster aid bill into law. Help is now on the way to the millions of Americans who so desperately need it. Thank you to @SenatorLeahy and all of those who worked to get this package across the finish line.

Excited to learn that the @USArmy intends to invest $121 million into Redstone Arsenal for much-needed repairs to Building 5400! These improvements will undoubtedly benefit the @USArmyCCDC research mission and all of @TeamRedstone.

Today marks the 75th anniversary of US troops & our allies landing in Normandy, beginning the end of #WWII & forever shaping history. Proud to receive an outpouring of positive feedback from members of @ALHospitals & #AL residents thanks to @CMSGov’s proposal to adjust the #Medicare wage index. Thank you @SeemaCMS for continued efforts to correct this issue that has harmed our hospitals for over 20 years.

Excellent news - @TheJusticeDept has announced that #Anniston & #Oxford were selected as 2019 National Public Safety Partnership sites to help reduce violent crime. Proud to see #DOJ investing in #AL by providing resources to promote the safety & security of our state & nation.

AL’s #redsnapper season is now open! For the 2nd yr, the state is operating under an #EFP from @NOAA to allow state fisheries management more flexibility to set seasons. The Gulf’s red snapper fishery is vital to anglers & businesses. Looking forward to another prosperous season. pic.twitter.com/AHlcftiV1H
